channel.title: CVE Feed for Apache Software Foundation -- Apache OFBiz
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Apache Software Foundation -- Apache OFBiz

item.title: CVE-2023-51467|2024-08-19T07:48:14.509Z -- apache%20software%20foundation -- apache%20ofbiz
item.description: The vulnerability permits attackers to circumvent authentication processes, enabling them to remotely execute arbitrary code

item.title: CVE-2023-49070|2024-08-19T07:48:13.953Z -- apache%20software%20foundation -- apache%20ofbiz
item.description:
Pre-auth RCE in Apache Ofbiz 18.12.09.
It's due to XML-RPC no longer maintained still present. This issue affects Apache OFBiz: before 18.12.10. Users are recommended to upgrade to version 18.12.10

item.title: CVE-2024-23946|2024-08-13T18:55:27.477Z -- apache%20software%20foundation -- apache%20ofbiz
item.description: Possible path traversal in Apache OFBiz allowing file inclusion. Users are recommended to upgrade to version 18.12.12, that fixes the issue.

item.title: CVE-2024-32113|2024-08-07T16:20:22.139Z -- apache%20software%20foundation -- apache%20ofbiz
item.description:
Improper Limitation of a Pathname to a Restricted Directory ('Path Traversal') vulnerability in Apache OFBiz.This issue affects Apache OFBiz: before 18.12.13.
Users are recommended to upgrade to version 18.12.13, which fixes the issue.

item.title: CVE-2024-38856|2024-08-05T09:02:45.537Z -- apache%20software%20foundation -- apache%20ofbiz
item.description:
Incorrect Authorization vulnerability in Apache OFBiz.
This issue affects Apache OFBiz: through 18.12.14.
Users are recommended to upgrade to version 18.12.15, which fixes the issue.
Unauthenticated endpoints could allow execution of screen rendering code of screens if some preconditions are met (such as when the screen definitions don't explicitly check user's permissions because they rely on the configuration of their endpoints).

item.description:
Incorrect Authorization vulnerability in Apache OFBiz.
This issue affects Apache OFBiz: through 18.12.14.

Unauthenticated endpoints could allow execution of screen rendering code of screens if some preconditions are met (such as when the screen definitions don't explicitly check user's permissions because they rely on the configuration of their endpoints).
